step1.sentence: After months of debate, the board finally decided to adopt a policy that would allow employees to work remotely three days a week.

step2.story: The startup was growing fast, but employee burnout was becoming a serious problem. The CEO gathered the leadership team and proposed they adopt a policy of mandatory mental health days each quarter. Within weeks, morale improved and productivity actually went up.

step3.story: When Hannah joined GreenTech Solutions as the new HR director, she noticed something alarming: turnover had doubled in six months. Exit interviews revealed that employees felt overworked and undervalued. Hannah spent two weeks researching best practices at competing firms and presented her findings to the executive team. She urged them to adopt a policy of flexible scheduling combined with quarterly performance bonuses. The CEO was hesitant at first, worried about costs, but the data was convincing. Six months after implementing the changes, retention rates climbed back to their highest level in years.

meaning.realUsageKo: 기업, 정부, 조직 등이 공식적으로 새로운 규정이나 방침을 도입하고 시행할 때 사용합니다. 단순히 아이디어를 수용하는 것이 아니라, 공식적인 결정과 실행을 포함하는 표현입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'adopt'는 라틴어 'adoptare'(선택하여 받아들이다)에서 유래했으며, 'policy'는 그리스어 'politeia'(시민 행정)에서 왔습니다. 두 단어가 결합하여 조직적 차원에서의 공식적 도입을 의미합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 격식 있는 비즈니스 표현으로, 회의록, 보고서, 뉴스 기사 등에서 자주 쓰입니다. 'implement a policy'(정책을 실행하다)와 비슷하지만, adopt는 '결정하여 받아들이는' 과정에 초점이 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The company adopted a policy of zero tolerance for workplace harassment.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 회사는 직장 내 괴롭힘에 대한 무관용 정책을 채택했다.
